title: General
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum.

Possible evidence that the organism was photosynthetic:

  • Internal presence of photosynthetic membrane or chloroplast

  • High levels of oxygen gas or oxides in the surrounding rock

  • Evidence of photosynthetic pigments in cell

  • Chemical analysis of the fossil shows the presence of molecules associated with the photosynthetic process

Possible evidence that the organism was not photosynthetic:

  • Lack of photosynthetic membrane or chloroplast

  • Surrounding rock suggests anaerobic environment
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 points maximum.

Possible evidence that the organism was photosynthetic:

  • Internal presence of photosynthetic membrane or chloroplast

  • High levels of oxygen gas or oxides in the surrounding rock

  • Evidence of photosynthetic pigments in cell

  • Chemical analysis of the fossil shows the presence of molecules associated with the

    photosynthetic process

Possible evidence that the organism was not photosynthetic:

  • Lack of photosynthetic membrane or chloroplast

  • Surrounding rock suggests anaerobic environment

The student response earns one of the following points:

2 points maximum.

Possible evidence that the organism was photosynthetic:

  • Internal presence of photosynthetic membrane or chloroplast

  • Chemical analysis of the fossil shows the presence of molecules associated with the photosynthetic process

Possible evidence that the organism was not photosynthetic:

  • Surrounding rock suggests anaerobic environment

The student response earns two of the following points:

2 points maximum.

Possible evidence that the organism was photosynthetic:
